selectserver.title: Select server
selectserver.message:
Select the server you want to use, or manually input a base URL and API key.
To use a custom URL or client ID, input your choices then select Custom.

authorizing.title: Waiting for you
authorizing.message: Login to the app, and press OK when you're done.

settings.logoutwarning: Are you sure you want to log out?
settings.title: Settings

pendingattachments.title: Files are still uploading.
pendingattachments.message: Your Content will not include any files that are not fully uploaded. Are you sure you want to continue?

connectionerror.title: Connection error
connectionerror.generic: Check your connection to the Internet.

notfound.title: Not found
notfound.generic: The resource or page you were looking for could not be found.

flow.title: Could not find Flow
flow.generic: An error occurred when trying to fetch the Flow.

inappnotify.generic: An in-app notification could not be displayed.

emptycontent.title: No Content
emptycontent.encouragement: There's nothing here! Try posting something to fill the void.
emptycontent.flow: There's nothing here! {name} hasn't posted anything. Try again later; maybe there will be Content here!
emptycontent.error: There's nothing here. Try again later.

permissiondenied.title: Permission denied
permissiondenied.generic: You don't have permission to do this.
permissiondenied.specific: You do not have permission in {name} to {perm}.

deletefailed.title: Delete failed
deletefailed.message: You do not have permission to delete this content.

join.title: Join
join.description: Controls the admission of new members: whether or not new members can join.
join.request_description: If this permission is set to @:flow.update.permission.join.request, new members have to be approved by Flow staff to join.

post.title: Post
post.description: Required for a user to post Content in this Flow.

update.title: Update
update.description: Required for a user to change the avatar, name, description, or other details of this Flow.

read.title: Read
read.description: Required for a user to see Content posted in this Flow.

view.title: View
view.description: Required for a user to see the profile of this Flow. However, it is not required to see parts of the Flow's profile if it is referenced by something else (i.e. it is the author of forwarded Content or it is a member of another Flow).

delete.title: Delete
delete.description: Required for a user to delete other users' Content posted in this Flow.

pin.title: Pin
pin.description: Required for a user to pin Content or chat messages in this Flow.

anonymous.title: Post Anonymously
anonymous.description: Required for a user to post anonymously on this Flow. Removing this permission will not reveal the author.
anonymous.force_description: If Force is selected, all new Content in this Flow will be anonymous, and users cannot turn it off. This does not affect bots' ability to post.

confirm_delete.title: Are you sure?
confirm_delete.description:
If you delete this Flow, all Content and chat messages posted in it will be deleted, too. There is no way to recover anything.
With that in mind, will you proceed?

validate_id.hint: Use at least 3 letters, numbers, and/or these symbols: *!#@._-+=,/
validate_id.double_slash: Flow IDs cannot contain two consecutive slashes (//).
validate_id.private_sequence: You cannot create a Flow with this ID.

community.title: Community
community.description: A public forum with chat and open posting.
community.explanation: Anyone can post to Community Flows by default. Chat is always restricted to Flow members; however, anyone can join.

private_group.title: Private Group
private_group.explanation: This type of Flow is only available to members who were invited to join it, who can then post in it. It includes Chat by default.

story.title: Story
story.explanation: You've seen this layout on Instagram and Facebook, and a vertical variation on TikTok. It puts your media on full display on supported apps.

channel.title: Channel
channel.explanation: A powerful yet simple Flow preset. Viewing and reading posts is public, and joining the Flow is turned off. Members post under the Flow's name.

anonymous_group.title: Anonymous Group
anonymous_group.explanation: Members are always anonymous-- they post under the name of the Flow. Public viewing, reading, and joining is turned off. This is useful for Alcoholics Anonymous situations.

blog.title: Blog
blog.explanation: Supported apps, like this one, will show blogs in a slightly different format. They are best for posts of long-form text, such as for news articles or blogging.

collection.title: Collection
collection.explanation: Posting in this Flow is turned off. It follows other Flows so that you can browse posts more easily.

flows.joined: Flows you are a member of
